result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul C Trongard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 20 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul C Trongard

records.addlTxt:
9:09 AM Defendant Paul C Trongard in court.  Attorney Jorge R Fragoso in court for Paul C Trongard.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State is in compliance with victim's rights. 
Defendant completed counseling necessary to accept offer. 
For Count 2: Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.
Court orders the following:
$393.50 to be paid within 20 days or civil judgment entered subject to collections, as penalty for non payment of fine. 
Count 1 is Dismissed and read in.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A/Witness A/Witness B/Witness C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:52 AM Defendant Paul C Trongard in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Attorney Fragoso states he is inclined to challenge the battery charge but is agreeable to arguing at the next hearing so they may provide a motion.  The Court reserves the right to challenge and will enter a plea on behalf of defense today.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Attorney Fragoso requests a date in September as the defendant is currently enrolled in counseling.  Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 025618,
Payable Number: 468682,
Receipt Number: 22R 027677,
Amount: $20.00
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 06/16/2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
